LanguageData.AttractionCalculationSetting_desc: Change how attraction is calculated. 'Complex' is default, allows for the most sophisticated behavior, but can hurt performance. 'Simplified' is similar to 'complex' but uses simpler calculations. 'Vanilla' approximates vanilla attraction and is the least resource intensive.
LanguageData.GenderModeSetting_desc: This setting changes how gendered behavior works in Rimworld, within the scope of this mod. For example, straight women in Vanilla rimworld are only 15% as likely as men to initiate a romance. You can choose to remove this behavior, or inverse them (so that rules that apply to women now apply to men and vice-versa). Note that this is only for those behavior related to romance.
LanguageData.AverageKinseyFemale_desc: This defines the average sexuality of most women. If an alien race does not define their own average sexuality, Gradual Romance will use this instead. This overrides Psychology's kinsey generation setting.
LanguageData.AverageKinseyMale_desc: This defines the average sexuality of most men. If an alien race does not define their own average sexuality, Gradual Romance will use this instead. This overrides Psychology's kinsey generation setting.
LanguageData.ExtraspeciesRomance_desc: Defines how sapient extra-species romance works. "Never" means that extraspecies romance is impossible. "Xenophiles Only" restricts romances only to those with the Xenophile trait. "Only Xenophobes Never" means that only those with the Xenophobe trait will refuse extra-species romance, the default. "Captain Kirk" is like "Only Xenophobes Never", except that there are no attraction penalties for extra-species romance, making it a love-for-all.
LanguageData.SeductionModeSetting_desc: Influences who can seduce who and when. "No restriction" means anyone can seduce anyone, though people generally prefer their own partners first. "Relationships and Strangers" means colonists can attempt to seduce both those they are romantic with and total strangers, but not other colonists they have no relation with. "Relationships only" means that colonists will only seduce those they have a relationship with. "No Seduction" means a colonist will never attempt to seduce another colonist.
LanguageData.DetailedDebugLog_desc: Prints internal information about how flirts and attraction are calculated to the debug log, for balancing purposes. Guaranteed to spam your debug log to death.
LanguageData.BaseRomanceChance_desc: Influences the chance to start relationships. Numbers over 100 tend to accelerate relationships, while numbers below slow them down.
LanguageData.BaseBreakupChance_desc: Influences the chance to end relationships. Numbers over 100 tend to make relationships more fragile, while numbers below make them more stable.
LanguageData.BaseFlirtChance_desc: Influences the chance to initiate a flirt. Numbers over 100 make people more flirty, but not necessarily more successful. Below makes them more standoffish and reticent.
LanguageData.RomanceSuccessRate_desc: Influences how likely it is that any given romantic advance succeeds. Numbers over 100 make relationships quicker. Below makes relationships less likely.
LanguageData.SweetheartRate_desc: Turning this up makes it more likely that two pawns will become sweethearts, as opposed to lovebuddies. Tuning it down does the opposite.
LanguageData.DecayRate_desc: If two pawns have an informal relationship but haven't interacted in a while, this is the base chance their relationship will decay each day.
LanguageData.NumberOfRelationships_desc: Pawns with at least this number of relationships find it harder to make new ones. This is only for romantic and semi-romantic relationships. Set this arbitrarily high for a free-for-all.
LanguageData.PolygamousWorld_desc: Nobody cares about affairs. Makes the polygamous trait redundant. Somewhat dangerous to toggle on and off during a playthrough.
LanguageData.InformalLetters_desc: Send letters when an informal relationship changes. Turn this off if you are getting too much letter spam.
LanguageData.UseFacialAttractiveness_desc: Gradual Romance produces a facial attractiveness value for each pawn. With this toggled on, Gradual Romance will use that trait instead of the Beauty trait to calculate romance chance.
LanguageData.FailedToFindFlirt_error: A pawn attempted to flirt, but InteractionWorker_Flirt failed to pick one.
LanguageData.FailedToFindReaction_error: A pawn attempted to react to a flirt, but InteractionWorker_Flirt failed to pick a reaction.
LanguageData.DetailedAttractionLog_desc: Prints attraction calculations to the debug log. Will spam your log big time.
LanguageData.RerollBeautyTraits_desc: Every newly generated pawn has a chance to roll a beauty trait, without replacing any of their current traits. Makes these traits much more frequent, but they are generally less powerful than in vanilla Rimworld.
LanguageData.NoAttractivenessCurve_error: [GRADUAL_ROMANCE] Couldn't find an attractiveness curve for ThingDef {0}.
LanguageData.BaseSeductionChance_desc: Influences the base likelihood that seduction attempt works, all things being equal, before other factors are considered.
LanguageData.MinAttraction_desc: This is the minimum a pawn needs to be attracted to a given pawn for a seduction attempt, if the pawn isn't already in a relationship with another pawn.
